policy_html:
Sucuri Vulnerability Disclosure (Bug Bounty)

We take the security of our sites, users and data very seriously and we started this bug bounty program to make easier for researchers to report vulnerabilities to us.

Reported bugs will be assessed by our security team to determine if they qualify for a reward. If you find any vulnerability, please report them right away. We will try to review any submission in less than 7 days.

The more severe the issue, the highest the reward.

All reports must include a POC (proof of concept) and details on how it can be misused.

Scope

Any web properties owned by Sucuri (*.sucuri.net) are in the scope for this program. It also includes our WordPress and Joomla Plugins.

Targets

*.sucuri.net

Rewards

Qualifying bugs will be rewarded based on severity. Our minimum reward is $250 USD.

For more severe issues, including remote code execution, SQL injections, remote file include or any type of shell access, the reward will be higher (up to $5000).

You will also get a thanks note on our site.

Out of Scope

Any Sucuri customer website are out of the scope of this disclosure program.

Also, the following do not quality:

  • DoS, brute force, user enumeration or DDoS attacks
  • Physical attacks.
  • Bugs that rely on Social engineering.
  • CRIME/BEAST attacks
  • Banner or version disclosures.
  • Missing SPF
  • Directory listing (unless you can find sensitive data)
  • Links to SSLabs or about external cookies not being "secure" or "httponly".

Please do not report about brute force attempts on our login or password reset forms. CSRF only qualifies if it can be misused against any of our users. CSRF on our free scanner or our search box is not covered.

profile.about: Security Company Focused on Website monitoring, protection and remediaton. Used by more than 100,000 sites worldwide.
profile.name: Sucuri
